reviews.review_msg:
CMNS 388 Indigenous media was one of the best classes I've taken at SFU. Professor Crey really knows this field well and is passionate about the material.  
The lectures were engaging and didn't feel 3 hours long and we usually watched a film in the class which was great.

Her lectures were really engaging, interesting, and interactive. I took CMNS 388: Indigenous Media with her, so in that class, we often watched films by Indigenous directors and analyzed them together as a class which I really enjoyed. She is really nice and willing to help to outside of class. The only con is she is a fairly hard marker.

Up and left for multiple weeks with no explanation making the course disorganized and unclear, assignments needed more explanation (even TA was confused in both senses), extremely dry lectures. Made the one TA mark 6000+ words for each student at the end of the term (ouch). Did not enjoy this prof what so ever

I loved Terry's class. He really teaches you how to think outside the box and is a very brilliant & funny professor. His exams were also all open book/laptop/textbook but the questions were very abstract. I would definitely rec. a class w/ him if you want to open your perspective.
